title: resume fun
content:
I am looking to put together a resume for a print shop lackey position. What might be a font that would be modest or appropriate? The resume I am redesigning is in Frutiger.

Thanks

new to the forum! woo!

 [‹ First time design font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080501183911/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44544 "Go to previous forum topic") [Pixel font for knitting patterns ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080501183911/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44514 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Byron

comments.content: Yes, Frutiger might be appropriate (good design, readable and not over the top – some might say; boring …). With the condensed-styles (which i like) you can enhance the contrast a bit, if you like.
Im looking at Geneva and it looks to have better readability. What could I pair that with?
